page.title: 10Transport
page.content: Most people in Cardross travel out of Cardross for employment. The majority use private cars, often sharing transport with friends to cut the cost. Cardross is also served by trains and buses. There is a bus running to Helensburgh every 30 minutes and one to Glasgow, also every 30 minutes. The electric train service is also adequate, one train running in each direction every 30 minutes with more at peak travel time. To make life easier, it is necessary to have access to private cars. The main road to Glasgow is a very busy one and divides the village in two.
